net.gliblybits.bitsengine.utils

Class BitsTimer

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.gliblybits.bitsengine.utils.BitsTimer

  • public class BitsTimer
extends java.lang.Object
    This timer class uses the system clock to measure time intervals.
    The time interval may be returned in seconds or milliseconds.

    Since:
    0.1 - Streak
    Version:
    0.1 - Streak
    Author:
    Marc Wiedenhoeft - GliblyBits

      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      This method returns the time interval between now and the time

      Timer is paused?

      • BitsTimer

        public BitsTimer()

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start()
        This method starts the timer, if it wasn't started before.
        If the timer is paused, this method will reset the timer.

      • stop

        public void stop()
        This method stops/resets the timer.

      • pause

        public void pause()
        This method pauses the timer.

      • getMilliseconds

        public long getMilliseconds()
        This method returns the time interval between now and the time
        the timer was started.

        Returns:
        time intervall in milliseconds

      • getSeconds

        public int getSeconds()
        This method returns the time interval between now and the time
        the timer was started.

        Returns:
        time intervall in seconds

      • isStarted

        public boolean isStarted()
        Timer is 'running'?

        Returns:
        true if timer is 'running', false otherwise

      • isPaused

        public boolean isPaused()
        Timer is paused?

        Returns:
        true if timer is paused, false otherwise
